TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509ChainElementCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of this class is returned when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain.ChainElements%2A> property is called.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.security.crypto_89_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.security.crypto_89_1.cs)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.security.crypto_89_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElement[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElement[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: An integer representing the index value.
Docs.summary: Copies an object into an array, starting at the specified index.
Docs.exception: The specified is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the array.
plus the current count is greater than the length of the array.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of elements in the collection.
Docs.value: An integer representing the number of elements in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to determine how many elements are in the collection.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/fed71e14-2e1e-43eb-8bec-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/fed71e14-2e1e-43eb-8bec-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/fed71e14-2e1e-43eb-8bec-_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: An integer representing the number of elements in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an object that can be used to navigate through a collection of chain elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator> class implements <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>, which enables you to use methods such as <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Current%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Reset%2A> to view the contents of the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection of chain elements is synchronized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This value is always `false` because an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection> object is not thread safe.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate you select.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/8d44e74b-4aca-40e8-aa3a-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/8d44e74b-4aca-40e8-aa3a-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#4](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/8d44e74b-4aca-40e8-aa3a-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to access an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElement> object in the collection.

Docs.exception: is greater than or equal to the length of the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to an object.
Docs.value: A pointer reference to the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property returns the `this` pointer, which is a reference to an instance of the current class.

Docs.returns: A pointer reference to the current object.

The index of `array` at which to start copying.
Docs.summary: Copies an object into an array, starting at the specified index.
Docs.exception: The specified is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the length of the array.
plus the current count is greater than the length of the array.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object that can be used to navigate a collection of chain elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns an enumerator interface.
